metadata.Title: CVE-2017-7808 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A content security policy (CSP) "frame-ancestors" directive containing origins with paths allows for comparisons against those paths instead of the origin. This results in a cross-origin information leak of this path information. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 55.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7808` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 55.0.1+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
firefox-globalmenu - 55.0.1+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
firefox-mozsymbols - 55.0.1+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
firefox-testsuite - 55.0.1+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs38 contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '55.0.1+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.2').
